result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:29 pm - Defendant Michael J. Sauer appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Jr. appeared by video for Michael J. Sauer.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.

2:01 PM Defendant Michael J. Sauer in court.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Jr. in court for Michael J. Sauer.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Bail is set at $5000  recognizance bond with the condition that he is to have no contact with J.K. or any persons under the age of 18 unless it is incidental contact. He is also ordered to report to TRPD for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours, or if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
